name: consumer electronics production, mobile device, smartphone | consumer electronics, mobile device, smartphone | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24984/documentation

This activity represents the production of one unit of a smartphone. It includes the materials for the housing, coils, simcard holder, mainboard covers various parts for assembly. The battery, display, mainboard, earpiece + speaker, internal cables, connector, an external charging device as well as a data cable (Monier, 2007) are included through separate datasets. Data on the smartphone stem from a LCA study on the Fairphone 1, a mid-range smartphone from 2014 with 4.3 inch display and a total weight of 163.45g (Güvendik, 2014).;Sources:;- Güvendik, M. (2014). From smartphone to futurephone: assessing the environmental impacts of different circular economy scenarios of a smartphone using LCA.;- Monier, V. et al. (2007) Preparatory Studies for Eco-design Requirements of EuPs, Battery chargers and external power supplies, Final report.

From reception of materials and auxiliares at the factory gate. 

The activity includes the materials, processes and energy use for the production of a smartphone. The dataset includes the exchange "used smartphone" to take into account the disposal. Data on factory and packaging are not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/263:Manufacture of communication equipment/2630:Manufacture of communication equipment

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data for composition are from 2014 but represent current technology.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average electronic device.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Literature source points to manufacturing in China. The datasets includes the processing of metals and plastics as well as energy and tap water use.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: In the study (Güvendik, 2014), the phone was dismanteled and the components identified and weighed.

exchanges.description:
Literature Value. Represents the charing cable without plugs. Copper wire (0.0075kg) + Isolation (0.00186kg) + Nylon (0.0006kg) divided by dry mass of "cable, connector for computer, without plugs" (0.065kg/unit).
Source: V. Monier, S. Mudgal, L. Turunen, K. Schischke, C. Ciaglia, and N. F. Nissen, “Preparatory Studies for Eco-design Requirements of EuPs, Battery chargers and external power supplies, Final report,” 2007.

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value. Derived from the "tap water" use (303kg) in the production of a tablet (0.590kg) (Hischier, 2014) and scaled down according to the weight of the smartphone.
Source: Hischier, R., Achachlouei, M. A., & Hilty, L. M. (2014). Evaluating the sustainability of electronic media: Strategies for life cycle inventory data collection and their implications for LCA results. Environmental Modelling & Software, 56, 27-36.
